parameters.description: Print background graphics. Defaults to false.

parameters.description: Scale of the webpage rendering. Defaults to 1.

parameters.description: Paper width in inches. Defaults to 8.5 inches.

parameters.description: Paper height in inches. Defaults to 11 inches.

parameters.description: Top margin in inches. Defaults to 1cm (~0.4 inches).

parameters.description: Bottom margin in inches. Defaults to 1cm (~0.4 inches).

parameters.description: Left margin in inches. Defaults to 1cm (~0.4 inches).

parameters.name: marginRight
parameters.description: Right margin in inches. Defaults to 1cm (~0.4 inches).

parameters.description: Paper ranges to print, e.g., '1-5, 8, 11-13'. Defaults to the empty string, which means print all pages.

domains.description: This domain emulates different environments for the page.

types.description: advance: If the scheduler runs out of immediate work, the virtual time base may fast forward to allow the next delayed task (if any) to run; pause: The virtual time base may not advance; pauseIfNetworkFetchesPending: The virtual time base may not advance if there are any pending resource fetches.

parameters.name: fitWindow
parameters.description: Whether a view that exceeds the available browser window area should be scaled down to fit.

commands.name: forceViewport
commands.description: Overrides the visible area of the page. The change is hidden from the page, i.e. the observable scroll position and page scale does not change. In effect, the command moves the specified area of the page into the top-left corner of the frame.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: X coordinate of top-left corner of the area (CSS pixels).

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: Y coordinate of top-left corner of the area (CSS pixels).

parameters.name: scale
parameters.description: Scale to apply to the area (relative to a page scale of 1.0).

commands.name: resetViewport
commands.description: Resets the visible area of the page to the original viewport, undoing any effects of the forceViewport command.

commands.description: Requests that page scale factor is reset to initial values.

parameters.name: pageScaleFactor
parameters.description: Page scale factor.

commands.description: Resizes the frame/viewport of the page. Note that this does not affect the frame's container (e.g. browser window). Can be used to produce screenshots of the specified size. Not supported on Android.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: Frame width (DIP).

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: Frame height (DIP).

parameters.description: Whether script execution should be disabled in the page.

parameters.name: rate

commands.name: setVirtualTimePolicy
commands.description: Turns on virtual time for all frames (replacing real-time with a synthetic time source) and sets the current virtual time policy.  Note this supersedes any previous time budget.

parameters.name: budget
parameters.description: If set, after this many virtual milliseconds have elapsed virtual time will be paused and a virtualTimeBudgetExpired event is sent.

commands.name: setDefaultBackgroundColorOverride
commands.description: Sets or clears an override of the default background color of the frame. This override is used if the content does not specify one.

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: RGBA of the default background color. If not specified, any existing override will be cleared.

events.name: virtualTimeBudgetExpired
events.description: Notification sent after the virual time budget for the current VirtualTimePolicy has run out.

types.description: The security level of a page or resource.

properties.name: securityState
properties.description: Security state representing the severity of the factor being explained.

properties.name: summary
properties.description: Short phrase describing the type of factor.

properties.name: description
properties.description: Full text explanation of the factor.

properties.name: hasCertificate
properties.description: True if the page has a certificate.

types.description: An explanation of an factor contributing to the security state.

properties.name: ranMixedContent
properties.description: True if the page was loaded over HTTPS and ran mixed (HTTP) content such as scripts.

properties.name: displayedMixedContent
properties.description: True if the page was loaded over HTTPS and displayed mixed (HTTP) content such as images.

properties.name: containedMixedForm
properties.description: True if the page was loaded over HTTPS and contained a form targeting an insecure url.

properties.name: ranContentWithCertErrors
properties.description: True if the page was loaded over HTTPS without certificate errors, and ran content such as scripts that were loaded with certificate errors.

properties.name: displayedContentWithCertErrors
properties.description: True if the page was loaded over HTTPS without certificate errors, and displayed content such as images that were loaded with certificate errors.

properties.name: ranInsecureContentStyle
properties.description: Security state representing a page that ran insecure content.

properties.name: displayedInsecureContentStyle
properties.description: Security state representing a page that displayed insecure content.

types.description: Information about insecure content on the page.
The action to take when a certificate error occurs. continue will continue processing the request and cancel will cancel the request.

commands.name: enable
commands.description: Enables tracking security state changes.

commands.name: disable
commands.description: Disables tracking security state changes.

commands.name: showCertificateViewer
commands.description: Displays native dialog with the certificate details.

commands.name: handleCertificateError
commands.description: Handles a certificate error that fired a certificateError event.

parameters.name: eventId
parameters.description: The ID of the event.

parameters.name: action

domains.description:
This domain exposes DOM read/write operations. Each DOM Node is represented with its mirror object that has an id. This id can be used to get additional information on the Node, resolve it into the JavaScript object wrapper, etc. It is important that client receives DOM events only for the nodes that are known to the client. Backend keeps track of the nodes that were sent to the client and never sends the same node twice. It is client's responsibility to collect information about the nodes that were sent to the client.

Note that iframe owner elements will return corresponding document elements as their child nodes.

types.description: Unique DOM node identifier used to reference a node that may not have been pushed to the front-end.
Backend node with a friendly name.

properties.name: nodeId
properties.description: Node identifier that is passed into the rest of the DOM messages as the nodeId. Backend will only push node with given id once. It is aware of all requested nodes and will only fire DOM events for nodes known to the client.

properties.name: parentId
properties.description: The id of the parent node if any.

properties.name: children
properties.description: Child nodes of this node when requested with children.

properties.name: attributes
properties.description: Attributes of the Element node in the form of flat array [name1, value1, name2, value2].

properties.name: documentURL
properties.description: Document URL that Document or FrameOwner node points to.

properties.name: baseURL
properties.description: Base URL that Document or FrameOwner node uses for URL completion.

properties.name: xmlVersion
properties.description: Document's XML version in case of XML documents.

properties.name: pseudoType
properties.description: Pseudo element type for this node.

properties.name: frameId
properties.description: Frame ID for frame owner elements.

properties.name: contentDocument
properties.description: Content document for frame owner elements.

properties.name: shadowRoots
properties.description: Shadow root list for given element host.

properties.name: templateContent
properties.description: Content document fragment for template elements.

properties.name: pseudoElements

properties.name: importedDocument
properties.description: Import document for the HTMLImport links.

properties.name: distributedNodes
properties.description: Distributed nodes for given insertion point.

domains.description: This domain exposes CSS read/write operations. All CSS objects (stylesheets, rules, and styles) have an associated id used in subsequent operations on the related object. Each object type has a specific id structure, and those are not interchangeable between objects of different kinds. CSS objects can be loaded using the get*ForNode() calls (which accept a DOM node id). A client can also discover all the existing stylesheets with the getAllStyleSheets() method (or keeping track of the styleSheetAdded/styleSheetRemoved events) and subsequently load the required stylesheet contents using the getStyleSheet[Text]() methods.

types.description: Stylesheet type: "injected" for stylesheets injected via extension, "user-agent" for user-agent stylesheets, "inspector" for stylesheets created by the inspector (i.e. those holding the "via inspector" rules), "regular" for regular stylesheets.

domains.description: Runtime domain exposes JavaScript runtime by means of remote evaluation and mirror objects. Evaluation results are returned as mirror object that expose object type, string representation and unique identifier that can be used for further object reference. Original objects are maintained in memory unless they are either explicitly released or are released along with the other objects in their object group.

Once this command is issued, all existing parsed scripts will have breakpoints resolved and returned in locations property. Further matching script parsing will result in subsequent breakpointResolved events issued. This logical breakpoint will survive page reloads.

commands.description: Replace previous blackbox patterns with passed ones. Forces backend to skip stepping/pausing in scripts with url matching one of the patterns. VM will try to leave blackboxed script by performing 'step in' several times, finally resorting to 'step out' if unsuccessful.

parameters.name: scriptId
parameters.description: Id of the script.

commands.description: Makes backend skip steps in the script in blackboxed ranges. VM will try leave blacklisted scripts by performing 'step in' several times, finally resorting to 'step out' if unsuccessful. Positions array contains positions where blackbox state is changed. First interval isn't blackboxed. Array should be sorted.
